snippet: A National Federation of Independent Business survey on owner optimism coincided with a government survey showing that job openings slipped in March.
abstract: National Federation of Independent Business reports that its Small Business Optimism index rose 1.7 points to 96.9 in April, supporting opinions that economic growth is rebounding after poor first quarter; Labor Department reports that job openings slipped 150,000 to five million in March, though openings remain 18.6 percent above year-earlier period.
lead_paragraph: A National Federation of Independent Business survey on owner optimism coincided with a government survey showing that job openings slipped in March.

headline.main: Small-Business Owners Gained Confidence in April
headline.print_headline: Confidence Rises for Small-Business Owners, and Most Are Investing
